To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Of Chaldee origin; son of Nabas; Barnabas, an Israelite.

36.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
36.str2: From epi and strepho; to revert.

36.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 1st Person Plural
36.str2: To look upon, visit, look out, select.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

36.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Feminine Plural
36.str2: Who, which, what, that.

36.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
36.str2: To declare openly, proclaim, preach, laud, celebrate. From kata and the base of aggelos; to proclaim, promulgate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

36.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
36.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

37.str2: Of Chaldee origin; son of Nabas; Barnabas, an Israelite.

37.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
37.str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.
To take along as a companion. From sun and paralambano; to take along in company.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

37.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
37.str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Of Latin origin; Marcus, a Christian.

38.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

38.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: To account or treat as worthy. From axios; to deem entitled or fit.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
To take along as a companion. From sun and paralambano; to take along in company.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

38.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
38.str2: From apo and histemi; to remove, i.e. instigate to revolt; usually to desist, desert, etc.

38.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
38.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From a compound of pas and pura; every-tribal, i.e. Heterogeneous; Pamphylia, a region of Asia Minor.

38.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
38.str2: From sun and erchomai; to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or, cohabit.

38.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
38.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

39.str2: Stimulation, provocation, irritation, angry dispute. From paroxuno; incitement, or dispute.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

39.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
39.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
To separate from; mid: I part; pass: To be swept aside. From apo and chorizo; to rend apart; reflexively, to separate.

39.parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural
39.str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
Of Chaldee origin; son of Nabas; Barnabas, an Israelite.

39.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
39.str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.
Of Latin origin; Marcus, a Christian.
To sail out (of harbor), sail away. From ek and pleo; to depart by ship.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Cyprus. Of uncertain origin; Cyprus, an island in the Mediterranean.

40.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

40.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
40.str2: To call; mid: I choose for myself; pass: To be named. Middle voice from epi and lego; to surname, select.
Silas, a pet-form of the name Silvanus; a Roman citizen and a helper of Paul. Contraction for Silouanos; Silas, a Christian.

40.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
40.str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.

40.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
40.str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

41.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

41.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
41.str2: To pass through, spread (as a report). From dia and erchomai; to traverse.
Syria, a great Roman imperial province, united with Cilicia. Probably of Hebrew origin; Syria, a region of Asia.
Probably of foreign origin; Cilicia, a region of Asia Minor.

41.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
41.str2: To prop up, uphold, support, confirm, make stronger. From epi and sterizo; to support further, i.e. Reestablish.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
